doc.repnme: The England and Wales electricity model : option or warning for developing countries?
doc.abstracts: In the late 1980s and early 1990s, the England and Wales power supply industry underwent the most radical transformation ever experienced by such an industry, swiftly evolving from a state-owned, state-controlled, integrated structure to a privately owned, autonomously regulated, unbundled structure. The authors discusses the lessons for reformers in developing countries.
